definition: to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: Well, we ended up walloping them. We took every weight class.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们最终大败他们，赢得了所有重量级的比赛。

sentences.english: He swept his match winning 3 sets in a row in the finals.
sentences.chinese: 在决赛中他以三连胜大败对手。
他们以20比0大败他们的敌手。

sentences.english: Hey, wouldn't it be worth it if it'll crush the Jags ?
sentences.chinese: 嘿如果能大败捷豹队难道不值得么？

sentences.english: Switzerland beat Togo 2-0, while Ukraine trounced Saudi Arabia 4-0.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士2比0战胜多哥，而乌克兰则以4比0大败沙特。

sentences.english: Chosin Reservoir was mostly a disaster for the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 长津湖主要对于中国人是一场大败。

sentences.english: The poverty in our cities is a damning indictment of modern society.
sentences.chinese: 我们的城市中的贫民苦况是现代社会的一大败象。

sentences.english: Alternatively, we can persist in the magical thinking whose results have just come crashing home.
sentences.chinese: 或者，我们可以坚持魔法思维，其结果刚刚大败而回。

definition: to lose a war
to run away (in defeat)
to retreat in defeat
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to attack (the enemy)
to go on a punitive expedition
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
to defeat/to smash/to rout
to fight with all one's might
troops under one's command
to attack and seize
to dispatch an army/to send troops
lost battle/defeat
